causal_relationships.mechanism: Fuels cancers that have estrogen receptors on cell surface
causal_relationships.evidence_mentioned: Studies show tamoxifen (anti-estrogen) reduces breast cancer incidence by 50%
Increases lifetime risk from 12.5% to 60-80%

causal_relationships.mechanism: Same genetic abnormality affects multiple organs
causal_relationships.evidence_mentioned: Increases risk for ovarian, pancreatic, and prostate cancers in relatives

causal_relationships.mechanism: Tightly packed tissue is harder to see through
causal_relationships.evidence_mentioned: Mammogram alone in dense breasts is incomplete exam

causal_relationships.mechanism: Earlier stage cancers require less aggressive treatment
causal_relationships.evidence_mentioned: Stage 1 patients less likely to need chemotherapy, can preserve breast
Used in Tyrer-Cuzick risk model
Breast becomes less dense over time, easier to see through

causal_relationships.mechanism: Liquid sugar affects body composition and metabolic drivers
causal_relationships.evidence_mentioned: Probably not direct, but affects BMI and metabolic health

causal_relationships.cause: Lifestyle medicine pillars (exercise, nutrition, sleep, stress management)
causal_relationships.evidence_mentioned: Risk is dynamic and modifiable through lifestyle changes

assessment_construct_links.measurement_quality: Flawed - wrong time horizon for clinical decisions, difficult for patients to complete accurately
Better for chemoprevention decisions
Too complicated, rules-based rather than scored
High - superior to 2D, improved accuracy with AI pattern recognition

constructs_measured: Lesions missed by mammogram in dense tissue
assessment_construct_links.measurement_quality: Good supplemental tool for dense breasts
High sensitivity for high-risk patients
High accuracy, now affordable at $250
Poor for breast cancer - not sensitive or specific enough, especially for premenopausal women
Emerging technology to address subjective image acquisition

target_outcomes: Detect cancers missed by mammogram in dense tissue
moderating_factors: Breast density category C or D

target_populations.population: Women at High Risk for Breast Cancer
target_populations.characteristics: Tyrer-Cuzick score >20%, strong family history, genetic mutations, dense breast tissue
target_populations.specific_needs: Precision screening with MRI, genetic counseling, chemoprevention consideration, lifestyle modification

target_populations.population: Women with Intermediate Breast Cancer Risk
target_populations.characteristics: Tyrer-Cuzick score 15-20%, moderate family history, category C/D breast density
target_populations.specific_needs: Enhanced screening with ultrasound, annual risk reassessment, lifestyle counseling

target_populations.characteristics: Eligible for routine mammography screening, minimal family history
target_populations.specific_needs: Annual 3D mammography, risk assessment surveys, education about risk factors

target_populations.characteristics: Active cancer treatment or post-treatment surveillance
target_populations.specific_needs: Treatment management, survivorship care, family risk assessment, genetic testing

target_populations.characteristics: BRCA1/2 or other hereditary cancer syndrome mutations
target_populations.specific_needs: Multi-organ surveillance, risk-reducing interventions, family cascade testing, specialized counseling

target_populations.characteristics: DNA relatives of individuals with cancer or genetic mutations
target_populations.specific_needs: Genetic risk assessment, cascade testing, early screening initiation, risk counseling

target_populations.characteristics: Family history of hereditary cancer syndromes, particularly BRCA mutations
target_populations.specific_needs: Genetic testing, prostate cancer screening, breast cancer awareness, family planning counseling

measurable_concepts.description: Likelihood of developing breast cancer from present day to end of lifetime, expressed as percentage
measurable_concepts.why_important: Determines screening intensity and intervention recommendations; threshold >20% qualifies as high-risk requiring enhanced surveillance
measurable_concepts.measurement_approach: Tyrer-Cuzick calculator using personal/family history, lifestyle factors, and breast characteristics

measurable_concepts.description: Likelihood of developing breast cancer within next 10 years
measurable_concepts.why_important: Informs chemoprevention decisions; >1.66% per year qualifies for tamoxifen consideration
measurable_concepts.measurement_approach: Gail model calculator using age, race, reproductive history, and family history

measurable_concepts.description: Amount of fibroglandular tissue relative to fatty tissue in breast
measurable_concepts.why_important: Category C/D density masks cancer detection and independently increases cancer risk; determines need for supplemental screening
measurable_concepts.measurement_approach: BI-RADS density categories A-D from mammography with AI-assisted quantification

measurable_concepts.description: Inherited predisposition to cancer based on DNA mutations
measurable_concepts.why_important: High-penetrance mutations like BRCA can increase lifetime risk to 60-80% and affect multiple cancer types
measurable_concepts.measurement_approach: NCCN guidelines-based family history assessment followed by genetic testing if criteria met

measurable_concepts.description: Computer-assisted detection of suspicious lesions on mammography
measurable_concepts.why_important: Improves cancer detection accuracy and reduces missed cancers through pattern recognition
measurable_concepts.measurement_approach: AI algorithms applied to mammographic images with confidence scoring and lesion marking

measurable_concepts.description: Assessment of whether mammographic images adequately capture all breast tissue
measurable_concepts.why_important: Poor positioning can miss cancers in inadequately imaged areas, especially in larger/deformable breasts
measurable_concepts.measurement_approach: Third-party software analysis (e.g., Densitas) evaluating tissue capture and positioning

measurable_concepts.description: Weight-to-height ratio used as proxy for body composition in risk calculations
measurable_concepts.why_important: Higher BMI increases breast cancer risk; modifiable factor that can reduce risk when improved
measurable_concepts.measurement_approach: Height and weight measurements calculated as kg/m² or included in risk assessment surveys

measurable_concepts.description: Lifetime exposure to estrogen through reproductive events and medications
measurable_concepts.why_important: Estrogen drives hormone-receptor positive breast cancers; longer exposure increases risk
measurable_concepts.measurement_approach: Gynecologic history questionnaire covering menarche, menopause, pregnancies, hormone use

measurable_concepts.description: Detailed family tree showing cancer diagnoses, ages, and relationships up to third-degree relatives
measurable_concepts.why_important: Identifies hereditary cancer patterns and qualifies individuals for genetic testing
measurable_concepts.measurement_approach: Structured family history questionnaire with age at diagnosis and cancer type for each relative

measurable_concepts.description: Pathology findings from previous breast tissue sampling
measurable_concepts.why_important: High-risk lesions like atypical ductal hyperplasia significantly increase future cancer risk
measurable_concepts.measurement_approach: Medical record review and patient history of specific pathologic diagnoses

measurable_concepts.description: Previous therapeutic or occupational radiation exposure, particularly chest radiation
measurable_concepts.why_important: Chest radiation, especially at young age, dramatically increases breast cancer risk
measurable_concepts.measurement_approach: Social history questionnaire covering medical treatments and occupational exposures

measurable_concepts.description: Regular alcohol intake patterns and quantity
measurable_concepts.why_important: May indirectly increase risk through metabolic effects and body composition changes
measurable_concepts.measurement_approach: Social history questionnaire and lifestyle assessment surveys

measurable_concepts.description: Tobacco use patterns including duration, quantity, and cessation
measurable_concepts.why_important: Known risk factor for multiple cancers with no therapeutic benefit
measurable_concepts.measurement_approach: Social history questionnaire covering pack-years and cessation timeline

measurable_concepts.description: Current hormonal state regarding menstruation and ovarian function
measurable_concepts.why_important: Affects breast density, cancer risk, and screening recommendations; postmenopausal women have different risk profiles
measurable_concepts.measurement_approach: Gynecologic history and current symptom assessment

measurable_concepts.description: Marital status, family structure, and social connections
measurable_concepts.why_important: Affects treatment compliance, stress levels, and overall health outcomes
measurable_concepts.measurement_approach: Social history questionnaire covering relationships and support networks

protocols_and_procedures.detailed_protocol: Patient receives link or QR code 5 days before appointment to complete questionnaire on mobile device using conditional logic guided questions
Patient positioning in mammography unit, image acquisition by technologist, AI-assisted analysis, radiologist interpretation
quality_control_measures: radiologist final approval of density reading

protocols_and_procedures.detailed_protocol: Advanced mammography with multiple image acquisition and 3D reconstruction

limitations: variable image quality based on technique

what_it_measures: breast density categorization (A, B, C, D)

intervention_strategies.description: Additional imaging performed alongside mammography for women with dense breast tissue (category C or D) or intermediate breast cancer risk (15-20% Tyra-Cusk score)
target_outcomes: Improve early detection in dense breast tissue
intervention_strategies.mechanism_of_action: Uses ultrasound technology to visualize breast tissue that may be obscured by density on mammography
intervention_strategies.typical_candidates: Women with category C or D breast density, or Tyra-Cusk score 15-20%

intervention_strategies.description: High-resolution magnetic resonance imaging performed as supplemental screening for high-risk women
target_outcomes: Early detection of breast cancer in high-risk women
Identify cancers not visible on mammography or ultrasound
intervention_strategies.mechanism_of_action: Uses magnetic fields and contrast agents to provide detailed breast tissue imaging with higher sensitivity than mammography
intervention_strategies.typical_candidates: Women with Tyra-Cusk score >20% lifetime breast cancer risk

intervention_strategies.description: Anti-estrogen medication taken as a pill to reduce breast cancer risk in high-risk women
intervention_strategies.mechanism_of_action: Blocks estrogen receptors to prevent estrogen from fueling potential breast cancers
intervention_strategies.typical_candidates: Women with Gail score >1.66% 10-year breast cancer risk

intervention_strategies.description: DNA analysis to identify hereditary cancer mutations through blood or saliva samples
intervention_strategies.mechanism_of_action: Analyzes DNA for mutations in cancer-associated genes like BRCA1/BRCA2
intervention_strategies.typical_candidates: Individuals meeting NCCN genetic testing criteria based on personal/family history

intervention_strategies.description: Individualized imaging schedule based on personal risk factors rather than standard annual screening
target_outcomes: Optimize early detection based on individual risk
intervention_strategies.mechanism_of_action: Tailors screening frequency and modalities to individual risk profile
intervention_strategies.typical_candidates: All women, with protocols adjusted based on risk stratification

intervention_strategies.description: Structured physical activity program to reduce breast cancer risk through body composition improvement
intervention_strategies.mechanism_of_action: Improves metabolic health, reduces inflammation, and optimizes hormone levels
intervention_strategies.typical_candidates: Women with elevated breast cancer risk, particularly those with high BMI

intervention_strategies.description: Personalized nutrition plan to optimize body composition and reduce cancer risk factors
intervention_strategies.mechanism_of_action: Addresses metabolic drivers of cancer through dietary optimization
intervention_strategies.typical_candidates: Women seeking to modify breast cancer risk factors

intervention_strategies.description: Educational intervention to reduce alcohol consumption as part of risk reduction strategy
intervention_strategies.mechanism_of_action: Eliminates liquid sugar intake and potential metabolic disruption from alcohol
intervention_strategies.typical_candidates: Women with elevated breast cancer risk who consume alcohol regularly

intervention_strategies.description: Interventions to reduce chronic stress as part of comprehensive risk reduction
intervention_strategies.mechanism_of_action: Addresses stress-related inflammation and hormonal disruption
intervention_strategies.typical_candidates: Women with elevated stress levels and breast cancer risk factors

intervention_strategies.description: Systematic approach to inform family members about hereditary cancer risk and screening recommendations
target_outcomes: Increase family awareness of hereditary risk
intervention_strategies.mechanism_of_action: Leverages genetic information to identify and screen at-risk family members
intervention_strategies.typical_candidates: Families with identified genetic mutations or strong cancer history

detailed_protocols.implementation_details: Performed at certified imaging centers with contrast enhancement
Requires medical supervision and regular monitoring for side effects

dosage_parameters.duration: Ongoing while density remains C/D or risk 15-20%
dosage_parameters.progression_rules: Continue based on density and risk factors

detailed_protocols.implementation_details: Performed immediately following mammography at imaging centers

resource_requirements.expertise_level_required: Specialized radiologist with breast MRI training

equipment_needed: Blood draw supplies or saliva collection kit
resource_requirements.time_investment: 15 minutes for sample collection, 2-3 weeks for results
resource_requirements.expertise_level_required: Genetic counselor for interpretation and counseling
Certified mammography technologists and breast imaging radiologists

resource_requirements.time_investment: Ongoing lifestyle modification with regular check-ins
resource_requirements.expertise_level_required: Multidisciplinary team including nutritionists, exercise physiologists, lifestyle medicine physicians

client_goals.goal_description: Early detection of breast cancer to improve survival rates and reduce treatment burden
Identify and stratify breast cancer risk to enable precision screening
Modify controllable risk factors through lifestyle interventions
Identify hereditary cancer risk in patient and family members

constraints_and_limitations.description: Less than half of breast imaging centers perform comprehensive risk assessment
constraints_and_limitations.impact_on_assessment: Limited access to proper risk stratification tools and surveys
constraints_and_limitations.impact_on_intervention: Inconsistent implementation of precision screening protocols
workaround_strategies: seek certified centers with 3D mammography and risk assessment programs

constraints_and_limitations.description: Patients often cannot accurately complete family history or personal medical history surveys
constraints_and_limitations.impact_on_assessment: Incomplete or inaccurate risk calculations due to missing/incorrect survey data
constraints_and_limitations.impact_on_intervention: Suboptimal screening recommendations based on flawed risk assessment
workaround_strategies: pre-visit survey completion with clinical verification
medical record review for missing information

constraints_and_limitations.description: Primary care physicians lack training, technology, or time for breast cancer risk assessment
constraints_and_limitations.impact_on_assessment: Risk assessment only occurs at breast imaging centers, missing 30 million eligible women
constraints_and_limitations.impact_on_intervention: Delayed or missed opportunities for risk-reducing interventions
workaround_strategies: implement risk assessment at breast imaging centers

constraints_and_limitations.description: Tyrau-Cusk model uses lifetime risk which doesn't match clinical decision-making needs
constraints_and_limitations.impact_on_assessment: Risk assessment time horizon doesn't align with immediate screening decisions
constraints_and_limitations.impact_on_intervention: Suboptimal timing and frequency of screening interventions
workaround_strategies: focus on actionable short-term risk factors

constraints_and_limitations.description: Insurance coverage dependent on meeting specific risk thresholds and guidelines
constraints_and_limitations.impact_on_assessment: Limited access to genetic testing and advanced imaging for some patients
constraints_and_limitations.impact_on_intervention: Screening frequency and modality constrained by coverage policies
workaround_strategies: ensure proper documentation of risk factors
patient self-pay options for critical assessments

moderating_factors.description: Tissue density affects mammogram sensitivity and cancer risk
moderating_factors.what_it_moderates: imaging effectiveness and supplemental screening needs
management_strategies: consider MRI for extremely dense tissue

moderating_factors.description: Menopausal status affects breast density and risk calculation accuracy
moderating_factors.what_it_moderates: risk assessment validity and imaging quality
management_strategies: hormonal status consideration in screening protocols

moderating_factors.description: Comparison imaging essential for accurate interpretation
moderating_factors.what_it_moderates: diagnostic accuracy and false positive rates
management_strategies: establish imaging continuity at same facility

moderating_factors.description: Incomplete family history affects genetic risk assessment accuracy
moderating_factors.what_it_moderates: genetic testing qualification and risk stratification

moderating_factors.description: BMI affects risk calculation and imaging quality
moderating_factors.what_it_moderates: risk assessment accuracy and mammogram positioning quality

moderating_factors.description: Patient adherence to screening recommendations varies significantly
moderating_factors.what_it_moderates: effectiveness of screening programs and early detection outcomes

moderating_factors.description: Technical quality of mammogram acquisition affects diagnostic accuracy
moderating_factors.what_it_moderates: cancer detection sensitivity and need for repeat imaging

practitioner_domains.domain_description: Comprehensive approach to optimal health and functioning using six pillars: nutrition, physical activity, sleep, stress reduction/management, substance use reduction, and positive social connection

practitioner_domains.domain_description: Hospital and outpatient treatment of chronic conditions using conventional western medicine approaches
practitioner_domains.specialization_notes: Management and prevention of chronic diseases with focus on cardiometabolic conditions

practitioner_domains.domain_description: Comprehensive assessment and management of insulin resistance spectrum from normal glycemic control to end-stage type 2 diabetes
practitioner_domains.specialization_notes: Full spectrum from prevention to advanced diabetes management

often see overlap here

looking for especially first-degree relatives with type two diabetes

higher prevalence of eating disorders in people seeking lifestyle optimization
people are stressed if the demands on them exceed their resources
